title.narrative: EVALUATION

description.narrative: Evaluations contribute in an effective and efficient manner to results for children, which contributes to Evaluation And Research. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Child poverty in all its forms is reduced through quality, evidence-based policies, programmes and budgets for all children, especially the most marginalized, at national and subnational levels

sector.narrative: Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

Building research capacity in UNICEF and the UN system

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Evaluations contribute in an effective and efficient manner to results for children

description.narrative: Governance arrangement for managing evaluations was changed towards a credible, transparent, impartial and quality evaluation process in accordance with 2018 UNICEF Evaluation Policy and United Nations Evaluation Group norms and standards. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2020

title.narrative: Percentage of newly commissioned evaluations that use appropriate evaluation-related programme information database (PIDB) codes
